â
'''QuickTime Alternative''' is a [[codec]] package for [[Microsoft Windows]] for playing [[QuickTime#QuickTime file format|QuickTime file format]], typically only playable by [[Apple Inc.]]'s official QuickTime software.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://codecnews.com/quicktimealt.htm|title=About QuickTime Alternative|date=2007-10-01}}</ref> QuickTime Alternative also includes [[Media Player Classic]] and the official QuickTime plugin required for playing QuickTime files (.MOV and others) in web browsers such as [[Internet Explorer]] and [[Mozilla Firefox]].{{Citation needed|date=September 2009}}
+
'''QuickTime Alternative''' is a [[codec]] package for [[Microsoft Windows]] for playing [[QuickTime#QuickTime file format|QuickTime file format]], typically only playable by [[Apple Inc.]]'s official QuickTime software.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://codecguide.com/about_qt.htm|title=About QuickTime Alternative|date=2007-10-01}}</ref> QuickTime Alternative also includes [[Media Player Classic]] and the official QuickTime plugin required for playing QuickTime files (.MOV and others) in web browsers such as [[Internet Explorer]] and [[Mozilla Firefox]].{{Citation needed|date=September 2009}}
â
'''QT Lite''' is a smaller version of QuickTime Alternative that does not contain Media Player Classic.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://codecnews.com/quicktimealt.htm|title=QT Lite|work=codecnews.com|accessdate={{date|2009-09-16}}|quote=QT Lite contains '''exactly''' the same components as QuickTime Alternative. The '''ONLY''' difference between the two packs is that QT Lite does not contain Media Player Classic.}}</ref>
+
'''QT Lite''' is a smaller version of QuickTime Alternative that does not contain Media Player Classic.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.codecguide.com/qt_lite.htm|title=QT Lite|work=codecguide.com|accessdate={{date|2009-09-16}}|quote=QT Lite contains '''exactly''' the same components as QuickTime Alternative. The '''ONLY''' difference between the two packs is that QT Lite does not contain Media Player Classic.}}</ref>
==Differences from Quicktime==
==Differences from Quicktime==
Line 25: Line 25:
{{Unreferenced section|date=September 2009}}
{{Unreferenced section|date=September 2009}}
*On March 10, 2006 version 1.56 of QuickTime Alternative was released. QuickTime Alternative 1.56 is the last version of ''QuickTime Alternative'' based on Apple QuickTime 6.0, which makes it the last version with support for [[Windows 9x]] and [[Windows NT 4.0]].
*On March 10, 2006 version 1.56 of QuickTime Alternative was released. QuickTime Alternative 1.56 is the last version of ''QuickTime Alternative'' based on Apple QuickTime 6.0, which makes it the last version with support for [[Windows 9x]] and [[Windows NT 4.0]].
â
*On June 9, 2007, a new page was created with instructions on allegedly how to install and configure the official QuickTime player for "optimal performance and user satisfaction".<ref>[http://codecnews.com/quicktimealt.htm QuickTime Installation Guide], CodecNews.com</ref>
+
*On June 9, 2007, a new page was created with instructions on allegedly how to install and configure the official QuickTime player for "optimal performance and user satisfaction".<ref>[http://codecguide.com/quicktime_installation.htm QuickTime Installation Guide], CodecGuide.com</ref>
*On June 28, 2007, ''QT Lite'' was introduced.
*On June 28, 2007, ''QT Lite'' was introduced.
*On September 14, 2007, QuickTime Alternative 1.90 was released, without any Pro functionality. Another change was the removal of DirectShow filters that were included in prior versions. QuickTime Alternative 1.90 was the last version with support for [[Windows 2000]].
*On September 14, 2007, QuickTime Alternative 1.90 was released, without any Pro functionality. Another change was the removal of DirectShow filters that were included in prior versions. QuickTime Alternative 1.90 was the last version with support for [[Windows 2000]].
